nodes.text: the Vice-President had given the  16  order no umbrellas
The order not to raise the umbrellas was the only means not to remind the President of Munich
The umbrella would have made clear the analogy to the president
Nixon wanted no such untoward  symbol
Geneva's traties on appeasement were at the moment similar to Munich ones that is they could be bringing disastrous consequences
The umbrella had been Chamberlain s  trademark and the emblem of his appeasement policy
If a symbol is showed what it represents is recalled
At that  moment it was still not clear whether Geneva had been a triumph or a setback for the  West
for lack of a better estimate of the situation there were uncomfortable  reminders of Neville Chamberlain and Munich
The appeasement in Munich brought disastrous consequences
